description: Universal RAG Retrieval Benchmark - 250 queries with ground truth
usage: Test any retrieval pipeline by ingesting benchmark_documents.json as corpus

queries.query: How do I authenticate API requests?
queries.ground_truth: Include your API key in the Authorization header using Bearer token format.

queries.query: What is the rate limit for the API?
queries.ground_truth: Rate limits are 100 requests per minute for free tier, 1000 for pro, unlimited for enterprise.
Use limit and offset parameters. Response includes total_count and has_more fields.
GET for retrieval, POST for creation, PUT for full update, PATCH for partial update, DELETE for removal.
Include version in URL path (/v1/, /v2/) or use Accept header with version parameter.
JSON is default. XML available via Accept header. CSV for bulk exports.

queries.query: How to filter results in API calls?
queries.ground_truth: Use query parameters like ?status=active&created_after=2024-01-01. Supports operators: eq, ne, gt, lt, contains.

queries.query: What are the API request size limits?
queries.ground_truth: Maximum request body is 10MB. For larger files, use multipart upload or presigned URLs.
Use sort parameter with field name. Prefix with - for descending. Example: ?sort=-created_at,name

queries.query: What is the API base URL?
queries.ground_truth: Production: https://api.example.com/v1. Sandbox: https://sandbox.api.example.com/v1

queries.query: How to make batch API requests?
queries.ground_truth: POST to /batch endpoint with array of operations. Maximum 100 operations per batch. Returns array of responses.

queries.query: What timeout should I set for API calls?
queries.ground_truth: Recommended 30 seconds for standard requests, 120 seconds for bulk operations. Server timeout is 300 seconds.
Webhooks retry 3 times with exponential backoff (1min, 5min, 30min). Return 2xx to acknowledge. Implement idempotency.

queries.query: What is the API response time SLA?
queries.ground_truth: P95 latency under 200ms for read operations, under 500ms for writes. 99.9% uptime guarantee.

queries.query: How to use API cursors for large datasets?
queries.ground_truth: Use cursor parameter from response next_cursor field. More efficient than offset for large datasets. Cursors expire after 24 hours.
401 Unauthorized means invalid or missing API key. Check Authorization header format and key validity.

queries.query: How to fix error 429 Too Many Requests?
queries.ground_truth: Implement exponential backoff. Check Retry-After header. Consider upgrading plan for higher limits.

queries.query: What causes error 500 Internal Server Error?
queries.ground_truth: Server-side issue. Retry with exponential backoff. If persistent, check status page and contact support with request ID.

queries.query: How to debug error 400 Bad Request?
queries.ground_truth: Check request body format, required fields, and data types. Error response contains field-level validation details.
Connection refused indicates service is down or firewall blocking. Check network connectivity and service status.

queries.query: How to resolve SSL certificate errors?
queries.ground_truth: Update CA certificates. Check system time. For self-signed certs in dev, configure trust store or disable verification (dev only).

queries.query: What does error code ERR_INVALID_TOKEN mean?
queries.ground_truth: Token is malformed, expired, or revoked. Generate new token. Check token hasn't been modified during transmission.
Add origin to allowed list in API settings. For development, use proxy or browser extension. Check preflight OPTIONS handling.
Network latency, server overload, or slow queries. Increase timeout, optimize query, or use async endpoints for long operations.
Valid auth but insufficient permissions. Check API key scopes. Request additional permissions from admin.
Connection timed out before response. Check network, increase timeout, or verify endpoint URL is correct.

queries.query: How to debug JSON parse errors?
queries.ground_truth: Validate JSON syntax. Check for trailing commas, unescaped quotes, or encoding issues. Use JSON validator tool.
Resource doesn't exist or wrong URL. Verify endpoint path, resource ID, and API version.

queries.query: How to fix memory limit exceeded error?
queries.ground_truth: Reduce batch size, paginate results, stream large responses. Increase memory allocation if possible.

queries.query: What does error code QUOTA_EXCEEDED mean?
queries.ground_truth: Monthly quota reached. Wait for reset or upgrade plan. Check usage dashboard for consumption details.
Python: pip install sdk-name. Node: npm install sdk-name. Requires Python 3.8+ or Node 16+.

queries.query: How to create a new project?
queries.ground_truth: Go to Dashboard > Projects > Create New. Enter name and description. Copy the generated project ID.
Use multipart/form-data POST to /files endpoint. Include file in 'file' field. Returns file_id on success.
Dashboard > Settings > API Keys > Generate. Select scopes and expiration. Copy key immediately - shown only once.
Settings > Webhooks > Add Endpoint. Enter URL, select events. Test with Send Test. Verify signature on receive.
Dashboard > Data > Export. Select format (CSV/JSON), date range, and fields. Large exports delivered via email link.
Use exponential backoff starting at 1 second, max 32 seconds. Retry on 429, 500, 502, 503, 504. Max 5 attempts.
Compute HMAC-SHA256 of request body using webhook secret. Compare with X-Signature header. Reject if mismatch.
Send DELETE request to /resources/{id}. Returns 204 No Content on success. Deletion is permanent.
POST to /search with JSON body containing query and filters. Supports AND/OR logic, nested conditions, and full-text search.
PATCH to /users/me with fields to update. Only provided fields are changed. Returns updated user object.
Settings > Team > Invite. Enter email and select role. User receives email with invitation link valid for 7 days.
Profile > Security > Enable 2FA. Scan QR code with authenticator app. Enter verification code. Save backup codes.
Billing > Invoices. Click PDF icon next to invoice. Or use GET /billing/invoices/{id}/pdf endpoint.
Billing > Subscription > Change Plan. Select new plan. Upgrades immediate, downgrades at next billing cycle.
Settings > API Keys > Select key > Revoke. Takes effect immediately. Active sessions using key will fail.
Projects > Select project > Actions > Clone. Choose what to include: settings, data, integrations. New project created with _copy suffix.
Reports > Create Schedule. Select report type, frequency (daily/weekly/monthly), recipients. Reports sent via email at scheduled time.

queries.query: How to set up email notifications?
queries.ground_truth: Settings > Notifications. Toggle categories on/off. Set digest frequency or real-time. Configure per-project overrides.
Trash > Select items > Restore. Items in trash for 30 days before permanent deletion. Pro plans have 90-day retention.

queries.query: What is the difference between PUT and PATCH?
queries.ground_truth: PUT replaces entire resource, requires all fields. PATCH updates only provided fields. PATCH is more efficient for partial updates.
Authorization framework for delegated access. User grants app limited access without sharing credentials. Uses access tokens with scopes.
Representational State Transfer. Architectural style using HTTP methods, stateless requests, and resource-based URLs.
Multiple identical requests have same effect as single request. Use Idempotency-Key header to prevent duplicate operations on retry.

queries.query: What is the difference between sync and async APIs?
queries.ground_truth: Sync returns result immediately. Async returns job ID, poll for status or receive webhook. Use async for long-running operations.
Query language for APIs. Client specifies exact data needed in single request. Reduces over-fetching and under-fetching.
JSON Web Token. Self-contained token with claims, signature. Contains user info without database lookup. Has expiration time.
Controls request frequency to prevent abuse. Limits per minute/hour/day. Returns 429 when exceeded with Retry-After header.
Managing breaking changes through versions. URL path (/v1/), header, or query param. Older versions deprecated but supported.
Hypermedia As The Engine Of Application State. Responses include links to related resources and available actions.

queries.query: What is difference between authentication and authorization?
queries.ground_truth: Authentication verifies identity (who you are). Authorization determines permissions (what you can do). Auth happens first.
HTTP callback triggered by events. Server pushes data to your URL instead of you polling. Real-time notifications.
Entry point for API requests. Handles authentication, rate limiting, routing, load balancing, caching. Single access point.

queries.query: What is difference between SDK and API?
queries.ground_truth: API is interface specification. SDK is pre-built library wrapping API calls with helpers, types, error handling. SDK simplifies integration.
Cloud execution model where provider manages infrastructure. Pay per invocation. Auto-scales. Examples: AWS Lambda, Azure Functions.
Free: 1000 requests/month. Starter $29: 50K requests. Pro $99: 500K requests. Enterprise: custom pricing, unlimited.
Yes, 14-day free trial of Pro features. No credit card required. Automatically converts to Free plan after trial.
Credit cards (Visa, Mastercard, Amex), PayPal, wire transfer for Enterprise. Invoicing available for annual plans.
Billing > Subscription > Cancel. Access continues until end of billing period. Data retained for 30 days after cancellation.
Yes. SOC 2 Type II certified. Data encrypted at rest (AES-256) and in transit (TLS 1.3). Regular security audits.
Primary in US (AWS us-east-1). EU option available (eu-west-1). Enterprise can choose region. GDPR compliant.
99.9% for Pro, 99.99% for Enterprise. Credits issued for downtime: 10% for <99.9%, 25% for <99.5%, 50% for <99%.
Full refund within 30 days for annual plans. Monthly plans prorated. No refunds for usage-based charges.
Email support@example.com. Pro: 24-hour response. Enterprise: dedicated slack channel, 4-hour response for critical issues.

queries.query: Is there an API status page?
queries.ground_truth: Yes, status.example.com shows real-time status, incident history, and maintenance schedule. Subscribe for email/SMS alerts.

queries.query: What languages are SDKs available in?
queries.ground_truth: Official SDKs: Python, JavaScript/Node, Go, Java, Ruby, PHP, .NET. Community SDKs for Rust, Swift, Kotlin.

queries.query: Can I use the API for commercial projects?
queries.ground_truth: Yes, all paid plans allow commercial use. Free tier for non-commercial and evaluation only. Check terms for reselling.
Enterprise plan includes on-premise option. Docker or Kubernetes deployment. Requires minimum 3-year contract.

queries.query: What happens if I exceed my plan limits?
queries.ground_truth: Soft limit: warning email at 80%. Hard limit: requests rejected with 429. Auto-upgrade available. Overage charges apply.
Active accounts: indefinite. Deleted items: 30 days (90 for Pro). Cancelled accounts: 30 days then permanent deletion.
Create .env file in project root. Set API_KEY, API_SECRET, ENVIRONMENT. SDK auto-loads from .env or system environment.
Set LOG_LEVEL to debug/info/warn/error. LOG_FORMAT: json or text. SDK logs to stdout by default. Configure custom handler.
Set HTTP_PROXY and HTTPS_PROXY environment variables. Or configure in SDK: client.setProxy('http://proxy:8080').
Set TIMEOUT_MS environment variable or configure in client: client = Client(timeout=60000). Default is 30000ms.
Settings > Custom Domain. Add CNAME record pointing to our endpoint. Upload SSL certificate or use auto-provisioned.

queries.query: How to set up IP allowlist?
queries.ground_truth: Settings > Security > IP Allowlist. Add CIDR ranges. Requests from non-listed IPs rejected with 403.
Settings > API > CORS. Add allowed origins (exact or wildcard). Configure allowed methods and headers. Max age for preflight.
Set DEBUG=true in environment or client.debug = true. Logs full request/response. Never enable in production.
Set MAX_CONNECTIONS (default 10), CONNECTION_TIMEOUT, KEEP_ALIVE. Higher pool size for high-throughput applications.

queries.query: How to set up multiple environments?
queries.ground_truth: Create separate projects for dev/staging/prod. Use different API keys per environment. Configure via .env.development, .env.production.
Enable in Settings > Security. SDK auto-signs requests. For manual: HMAC-SHA256 of method+path+timestamp+body with secret.

queries.query: How to set default response language?
queries.ground_truth: Settings > Localization > Default Language. Or per-request: Accept-Language header. Affects error messages and UI text.
Set MAX_RETRIES (default 3), RETRY_DELAY (1s), RETRY_MAX_DELAY (30s). Configure retryable status codes in SDK options.
Set Accept-Encoding: gzip header. For request body: Content-Encoding: gzip. Reduces bandwidth by 70-90%.

queries.query: How to configure webhook retry policy?
queries.ground_truth: Settings > Webhooks > Advanced. Set max retries (1-10), timeout (5-30s), backoff multiplier. Alert email on failures.
Generate new key, update applications, verify working, then revoke old key. Overlap period prevents downtime.
Redirect user to /oauth/authorize with client_id, scope, redirect_uri. Exchange code for token at /oauth/token. Store refresh token securely.

queries.query: What security headers should I use?
queries.ground_truth: Set X-Content-Type-Options: nosniff, X-Frame-Options: DENY, Content-Security-Policy, Strict-Transport-Security.

queries.query: How to store API keys securely?
queries.ground_truth: Never commit to git. Use environment variables or secrets manager (AWS Secrets Manager, HashiCorp Vault). Encrypt at rest.
Validate and sanitize all input. Use parameterized queries. Encode output. API validates but defense in depth recommended.
Enterprise feature. Configure SAML 2.0 or OIDC in Settings > SSO. Provide IdP metadata URL. Map attributes to user fields.
Settings > Audit Log. Shows all API calls with user, IP, action, timestamp. Export to SIEM. Retention: 90 days (Pro), 1 year (Enterprise).
Settings > Security > Session. Set idle timeout (default 30 min) and max duration (default 24 hours). Force re-auth for sensitive actions.
Encryption at rest enabled by default (AES-256). In transit: TLS 1.3. Enterprise: customer-managed keys (BYOK) option.
Profile > Security > MFA. Supports TOTP apps and hardware keys (WebAuthn). Backup codes for recovery. Can enforce org-wide.
Access tokens expire in 1 hour. POST refresh_token to /oauth/token. Store refresh token securely. Rotate on each use.
Permissions attached to API keys: read, write, admin, billing. Use minimum necessary. Scopes checked on each request.
Verify signature using webhook secret. Check timestamp within 5 minutes. Use HTTPS endpoint. Validate payload schema.
Create roles with permission sets. Assign users to roles. Check permissions: user.can('resource:action'). Custom roles on Enterprise.
Data export via API or dashboard. Deletion request honored within 30 days. DPA available. EU data residency option. Consent management APIs.

queries.query: How to improve API response time?
queries.ground_truth: Use connection pooling, enable compression, request only needed fields, implement caching, use regional endpoints.
Use batch endpoints instead of individual calls. Optimal batch size: 50-100 items. Use async for large batches.
Check Cache-Control headers. Use ETags for conditional requests. Cache responses client-side. Redis for server-side caching.

queries.query: How to handle large file uploads?
queries.ground_truth: Use multipart upload for files >100MB. Get presigned URL, upload directly to storage, confirm completion. Resumable uploads supported.
Enable gzip compression, use fields parameter to select specific fields, paginate results, use webhooks instead of polling.
Dashboard > Analytics shows latency, error rates, throughput. Set up alerts for thresholds. Export to Datadog, New Relic, etc.

queries.query: What are the concurrent request limits?
queries.ground_truth: Free: 10 concurrent. Starter: 50. Pro: 200. Enterprise: custom. Exceeding returns 429 with Retry-After header.
Replace api.example.com with region prefix: us.api, eu.api, ap.api. Reduces latency by 50-80ms for closer regions.

queries.query: How to optimize database queries via API?
queries.ground_truth: Use filters to reduce result set, avoid deep pagination (use cursors), request indexed fields only, use search instead of list+filter.

queries.query: How to handle high traffic spikes?
queries.ground_truth: Implement client-side rate limiting, use circuit breaker pattern, queue non-critical requests, upgrade plan for higher limits, contact for burst capacity.
Use tools like k6, wrk, or Apache Bench. Test from multiple regions. Measure p50, p95, p99 latency. Compare against SLA targets.

queries.query: How to reduce cold start latency?
queries.ground_truth: Keep-alive connections, use provisioned capacity (Enterprise), warm-up requests, smaller payload for first request.

queries.query: What is the maximum payload size?
queries.ground_truth: Request body: 10MB max. Response: 50MB max. For larger data, use file endpoints or streaming. Compression recommended.
Respond quickly (200 OK within 5s). Process async after acknowledgment. Use batch webhooks for high-volume events.
Use cursor-based pagination for large datasets. Keyset pagination is O(1). Offset pagination degrades with depth. Limit to 100 items per page.
Install Slack app from integrations page. Authorize workspace. Configure channels for notifications. Use /commands for quick actions.
Search for app in Zapier. Connect using API key. Select triggers and actions. Test zap before enabling.
Settings > Integrations > GitHub. Authorize OAuth app. Select repositories. Configure sync: issues, PRs, commits.

queries.query: How to set up Salesforce integration?
queries.ground_truth: Enterprise feature. Connect via OAuth. Map fields between systems. Configure sync direction and frequency. Custom object support.

queries.query: How to integrate with AWS S3?
queries.ground_truth: Provide AWS credentials or IAM role ARN. Specify bucket and path prefix. Enable for file exports or backup sync.

queries.query: How to connect to Google Sheets?
queries.ground_truth: Authorize Google account. Select or create spreadsheet. Map columns to fields. Configure one-way or two-way sync.
Connect Stripe account in billing settings. Enables automatic payment processing. Webhook events synced for payment status.

queries.query: How to set up JIRA integration?
queries.ground_truth: Settings > Integrations > JIRA. Authenticate with Atlassian. Select project. Map issue types and fields. Two-way sync supported.

queries.query: How to integrate with Microsoft Teams?
queries.ground_truth: Install from Teams app store or configure webhook. Post notifications to channels. Use cards for interactive messages.
Provide Datadog API key. Metrics exported automatically. Configure dashboards in Datadog. Set up alerts on anomalies.
Enter Twilio Account SID and Auth Token. Configure phone numbers for SMS notifications. Enable two-way messaging.

queries.query: How to set up PagerDuty integration?
queries.ground_truth: Create PagerDuty service integration key. Enter in Settings > Alerting. Configure alert routing and escalation policies.
Provide Elasticsearch endpoint, credentials. Configure index mapping. Enable log streaming or data sync. Bulk operations supported.
Enter SendGrid API key. Configure from email address. Test email delivery. Webhooks for bounce/delivery tracking.

queries.query: How to set up Okta SSO?
queries.ground_truth: Create SAML app in Okta. Download metadata XML. Upload to SSO settings. Configure attribute mapping. Test login flow.

queries.query: What file formats are supported for import?
queries.ground_truth: CSV, JSON, XML, Excel (xlsx). Max 100MB per file. Headers required for CSV. Schema validation optional.

queries.query: How to import data from CSV?
queries.ground_truth: Data > Import > Upload CSV. Map columns to fields. Preview first 10 rows. Choose create or update mode. Async for large files.

queries.query: How to export data to JSON?
queries.ground_truth: Data > Export > Select JSON format. Choose fields and date range. Download link sent via email for large exports.

queries.query: What are the data validation rules?
queries.ground_truth: Required fields must be present. Types validated: string, number, date, email, URL. Custom regex patterns supported. Max string length: 65535.
Set unique constraints on fields. Import options: skip, update, or fail on duplicate. Use upsert API for atomic create-or-update.
POST to /bulk/delete with array of IDs or filter criteria. Maximum 10,000 per request. Returns deletion count. Irreversible.

queries.query: What is the maximum record size?
queries.ground_truth: Single record: 1MB max. Total fields per record: 500. Nested depth: 10 levels. Array items: 10,000.

queries.query: How to transform data during import?
queries.ground_truth: Use field mapping with expressions. Functions: concat, split, format_date, lowercase. Custom JavaScript transforms on Enterprise.
Data > Sync > Create Schedule. Set source (API, database, file). Configure frequency: hourly, daily, weekly. Error notifications.
Null represented as null in JSON, empty string in CSV. Optional fields can be null. Use 'omit null' parameter to exclude from response.
Automatic daily backups retained 30 days. Manual backup via Data > Backup. Download or sync to S3/GCS. Point-in-time recovery on Enterprise.
ISO 8601 preferred: 2024-01-15T10:30:00Z. Also accepts: YYYY-MM-DD, Unix timestamp. Timezone defaults to UTC.

queries.query: How to migrate data between environments?
queries.ground_truth: Export from source environment. Import to target with ID preservation. Use migration API for large datasets. Verify record counts.
Data > Archive > Set criteria (older than X days). Archived data queryable but slower. Reduces active storage costs.
UTF-8 required for API. CSV import: specify encoding header. BOM handled automatically. Emoji and special characters supported.
Authentication error - check API key format and validity.
Database connection error - verify connection string and network access.
Configuration settings are managed via environment variables or config files.
Webhook setup: Settings > Webhooks > Add Endpoint.
API rate limits vary by plan: Free 100/min, Pro 1000/min, Enterprise unlimited.
Connection refused - service down or firewall blocking. Check status page.
SQL error code 42S22 indicates column not found. Check field names in query.
Windows error code for access denied. Check permissions.
Null reference error - check for missing required fields in request.
502 Bad Gateway indicates upstream server error. Retry or check status page.
C++ SDK available as community package. Use vcpkg or conan for installation.
Create .env file in project root with KEY=value format. Never commit to git.
OAuth 2.0 is simpler, uses tokens. OAuth 1.0 uses signatures. We support OAuth 2.0 only.
Module not found - run npm install. Check package.json and node_modules folder.
High CPU usually indicates inefficient code or infinite loop. Profile your application.
Connection refers to database connection, API connection, or WebSocket connection.
Timeout can refer to API request timeout, connection timeout, or session timeout.
Token refers to API token, JWT token, OAuth access token, or refresh token.
Key refers to API key, encryption key, or configuration key depending on context.
Error handling varies by type. Check specific error code for resolution steps.

queries.query: I followed all the steps in the documentation but when I try to authenticate it says invalid token even though I just generated it and copied it exactly
queries.ground_truth: Invalid token after generation - check for whitespace when copying, verify token type matches endpoint.

queries.query: we are experiencing intermittent failures with the API where sometimes requests work fine and sometimes they timeout and we cannot figure out the pattern
queries.ground_truth: Intermittent timeouts suggest network issues, rate limiting, or server load. Check response headers for rate limit info.

queries.query: after upgrading the SDK to the latest version all our tests started failing with serialization errors when sending dates to the API
queries.ground_truth: Date serialization changed - use ISO 8601 format. Check SDK changelog for breaking changes.
Authentication setup: Include API key in Authorization header as Bearer token.
Webhook configuration: Settings > Webhooks > Add Endpoint. Enter URL and select events.

queries.query: wie kann ich die API authentifizieren
queries.ground_truth: API authentication: Use Bearer token in Authorization header with your API key.

queries.query: What's the best way to handle pagination for real-time data that's constantly changing?
queries.ground_truth: Use cursor-based pagination with timestamp cursors. Cursors are stable despite data changes. Combine with webhooks for real-time updates.

queries.query: How do I implement optimistic locking to prevent concurrent update conflicts?
queries.ground_truth: Use version field or ETag. Include current version in update request. API returns 409 Conflict if version mismatch. Retry with fresh data.

queries.query: What's the recommended architecture for high-availability webhook processing?
queries.ground_truth: Use message queue (SQS, RabbitMQ) to decouple receipt from processing. Acknowledge immediately, process async. Implement idempotency with event ID.

queries.query: How to design a multi-tenant application using your API?
queries.ground_truth: Use separate API keys per tenant or JWT with tenant claim. Implement tenant isolation at application layer. Use metadata fields for tenant ID.

queries.query: What's the strategy for zero-downtime API key rotation?
queries.ground_truth: Generate new key, configure both keys in app, gradually shift traffic, monitor for old key usage, revoke after confirmation period.
